reviews.review: Nice ending to the Star Wars saga!

After Rian Johnson undid J.J's start and almost destroyed the trilogy I believe J.J and Lucas came through like God's in salvaging it. The movie entraining and has the feel and appeal of Star Was that made it so popular in the first place. If only they had gotten to do the last Jedi as well it might have been even more epic. Well done due to circumstances!
Thank you JJ for righting the ship.  I enjoyed this film very much.

Rushed and poor pacing. New planets where ones already existed in lore for the exact same purpose. JJ did what he could with what mess Kathleen Kennedy told him to clean up. For a guy not great at endings it was justifiable even if writing was rudimentary. It felt like star wars. Looked like star wars. Unlike the last film, I didn't have the urge to fall asleep. lots of nostalgia, maybe a little too much. Very slight character development. Critics clearly just want to imprint their stuck up views on everyone. I liked it. Didn't love it but it was a good ending with closure and nothing will ever, ever compare or come close to the OT.

Beautiful film that encapsulates the themes of the whole saga in satisfying ways. It's rushed and there's too much going on in the plot, but the performances, cinematography, soundtrack and sheer spectacle outweigh the clunky plot. Star Wars fans, as I am, should truly enjoy this.

Wanted to like this - no, wanted to LOVE this movie.  It felt very disjointed with no story flow and zero edge of your seat intrigue.  Action scenes for just the sake of action scenes and almost no character development or intricacies. That being said, the action scenes were good and when Adam Driver was on the screen - that boy can act, I just wish he'd been given more to work with.    I'll see it again just to make sure I didnt miss anything but honestly, Im not really looking forward to it.  What a bummer.

Definitely better than The Last Jedi.  Thinking about The Last Jedi, the only thing I really didn't like about it was the script, and maybe how the script dictated the actions of the actors.  I also didn't like how, seemingly to me, it didn't advance the story any, with the exception of getting Rey on her own.

Like, many said The Empire Strikes Back wasn't that good.  But, at least we had, "Luke, I am your father" to look back on.

The Rise of Skywalker, though, is a much better script, advanced the story much better.

There's very little detail/depth in each scene.  As a result, each scene may go quick for some.  But, it's still worth people's time to go see, I believe.

It stands out pretty well on its own as a movie.  It can help if you are aware of who the characters are (not the actors, but who the characters are they are playing).

I'd rate it about a 7-8 out of 10 (5 is average).

Ultimate question for me, would I go see it again?  Possibly.  Probably not, but possibly.  Maybe comparing it like this, I went to go see Knives Out recently.  I didn't like it.  I wouldn't go see it again.  When I see it's on TV, I'm turning the channel.  With The Rise of Skywalker, if I see it on TV, I don't think I'm turning the channel.
This whole trilogy is such a mess and this last installmemt makes it perfectly clear they had NO plan whatsoever on how this story should end up. SAD!

There is a lot to like about this one, and a lot of annoying, but overall it was a fun movie that doesn't end the saga on a sour note. I was really happy at the shots it took at TLJ too. Overall, not a great sequel trilogy, but this was the best of the three by far.

This movie is great it's fun and beautiful I liked the characters
and found the story interesting. This movie has a lot of easter eggs 
from the other movies which is great. The actors did great.
this movie is a must see.
